workshops.name: Khan Thompson
workshops.title: Building a Basic Haskell Web-Service in Servant
workshops.details:
I will be running a workshop on building a basic Haskell web service.

A lot of devs work in web (all the ones I work with at least ;)), and it’s sometimes hard to get off the ground when it comes to doing 'real work' at the same time as learning Haskell.

The goal for this workshop is for all attendees to have a working CRUD webservice connecting to a database that they can then extend. Depending on time limits, we can then discuss changing databases, adding additional endpoints and return types, and adding unit testing.

We will use the Servant framework for this. The database connection will be to SQLite, avoiding a more complicated setup. Therefore the only dependency will be stack and some development libraries.

I'd imagine that this would be done in around 2 hours, although I can provide a little more clarity on that when I’ve done a practice run on workmates. Attendees would need a laptop with stack installed and an editor setup and running.

I will take a step by step approach, introducing the tasks and their motivations, and then leaving attendees to complete the steps, pausing to help anyone who falls behind.
workshops.prereqs: The intended audience will be people who have learnt a little bit of Haskell (they are familiar with the syntax) but are interested in working through the ins-and-outs of building a web service, e.g. transformer-stacks, database-connections, authentication, etc.

workshops.name: Vaibhav Sagar
workshops.title: Git Internals Workshop
workshops.details:
Vaibhav will be presenting a talk followed by a workshop on the internals of Git.

Let's walk through a Git repository together and implement a Git of our own one step at a time.

See the related blog-post: I Haskell a Git!
workshops.prereqs:
• Basic competence with using Git and knowledge of Haskell and/or Python 3
  • Have stack and python3 installed
  • Nix is nice but not required
